repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Includes correspondence, 1955-1989; course syllabi and lecture notes, 1951-1979; offprints, 1957-1981; and a diary of a sabbatical leave, 1954-1955. Grenander was a professor of English at the New York State College for Teachers and the University at Albany from 1948 to 1989. Grenander was a scholar of the American writer Ambrose Bierce and corresponded with John Crowe Ransom about New Criticism and other literary topics.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mary Elizabeth (M.E.) Grenander was born in Rewey, Wisconsin on November 21, 1918. Grenander served during the Second World War and went on to recieve a PhD in English from the University of Chicago. Grenander started teaching at the State University of New York at Albany in 1948 and was the director of the Institute of Humanistic Studies from 1977 to 1980. Grenander retired from the University in 1989 and recieved the title of Distinguished Service Professor of English. Grenander was a scholar of the American writer Ambrose Bierce and corresponded with John Crowe Ransom about New Criticism and other literary topics.

Grenander was married to James Corbett, a physics professor from the University and donated $1 to the University in his memory in 1994. Grenander died in East Berne, New York on May 28, 1998. The M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives is named in her honor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes correspondence, 1955-1989; course syllabi and lecture notes, 1951-1979; offprints, 1957-1981; and a diary of a sabbatical leave, 1954-1955.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: M.E. Grenander donated materials to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in 1989. Additional materials were accessioned in 2017.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. Please contact an archivist for more information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites. Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder. The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks. The University Archives are eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, M.E. Grenander Papers, 1951-1989. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Grenander Papers).
